required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Can Creatine Supplementation Reduce the Negative Effect of Mental Fatigue on Cognitive Performance?
clinical_study.official_title: Can Creatine Supplementation Reduce the Negative Effect of Mental Fatigue on Cognitive Performance?

brief_summary.textblock: To assess whether creatine could play a significant role in postponing mental fatigue. To do so the investigators will seek to increase brain creatine concentration via a creatine supplementation protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Cognitive performance - change in accuracy (%) during a 90-min cognitive task (i.e. Stroop task)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During both lab visits (i.e. after both 7-day supplementation protocols); Accuracy (%) will be assessed during both lab visits with a 90-min cognitive task; Accuracy during the 90-min task will be reported as mean accuracy during 8 blocks of 11min15sec
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy (in %) will be assessed during a cognitive task, this cognitive task will be completed after both 7-day supplementation protocols (i.e. placebo and creatine)

primary_outcome.measure: Cognitive performance - change in reaction time (milliseconds) during a 90-min cognitive task (i.e. Stroop task)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During both lab visits (i.e. after both 7-day supplementation protocols); Reaction time (RT) will be assessed during both lab visits with a 90-min cognitive task; RT during the 90-min task will be reported as mean RT during 8 blocks of 11min15sec
primary_outcome.description: Reaction time (in milliseconds) will be assessed during a cognitive task, this cognitive task will be completed after both 7-day supplementation protocols (i.e. placebo and creatine)

intervention.description: Participants will have to supplement themselves with creatine for 7 days (20g/day).
Participants will have to supplement themselves with manitol for 7 days (20g/day).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy (No neurological illness including cardiovascular, renal, and endocrine disorder)
- Male/female
- No medication / supplements
- Non-smoker
- Low to moderately active
- Between 18 and 35 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Injuries
- Illness
- Use of medication
- Use of creatine in the last 3 months
- History of head trauma or seizure
- Vegetarian diet [24]
- Not being able to follow up the restrictions and prohibitions for the subjects (see Restrictions and prohibitions for the subjects)
